result.execSummary:
The defendant William R. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA sample
Counseling

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

defendant.name: Miller, William R.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Defendant William R. Miller in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:04 a.m. Statement by Defendant, asking that enhancer be removed. Court reviews copy of plea agreement presented by Defendant. Response by State. Court advises Def on what Court would need to be able to grant request. Court withholds ruling at this time. Def may request new hearing with notice to D.A.'s office.
Motion and Order To Reopen and Modify,   Attached Documents

Defendant William R. Miller in court, in custody with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 1:03 pm.  State has receive copy of Revocation and summary packet, State has statement to read from victim.  Atty Seifert has receive copy of revocation and summary packet  State reads victim impact statement.  State gives sentencing argument and recommends 90 days jail.  Atty Seifert gives sentencing argument and recommends, 38 days jail credit, request time served.  Court reads part of report.  State does not have any additional information.  Atty Seifert replys. State responds. Def. makes statement.  Court orders 60 days jail, Credit for 38 days, time served. Def. advised of postconviction rights. No civil judgment, costs paid. Huber Privileges.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant William R. Miller in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM225 and 13CM304 @ 9:48 a.m. 13CM304 State Def had paid DNA surcharge, for reasons stated may be refunded. Def asks that surcharge be applied to 15CM225. Court will order that DNA surcharge in 15CM225 is satisfied by DNA surcharge paid in 13CM304 which was refundable.

Defendant William R. Miller in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:13 a.m. Agreement stated - State has complied with VWNR, victim is present. Def will plead to charge, withheld sentence, 6 months probation, counseling, court costs. Def understands and agrees. Court reviews atty waiver. Court finds waiver knowingly and voluntarily made. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Court finds plea freely & voluntarily made with full understanding. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of disorderly conduct in dom. abuse setting. State heard on sentencing. Nothing by Defendant. Remarks by the Court, will follow agreement. Sentence withheld, 6 months probation, counseling, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Apply bond to costs, balance through probation.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.

Defendant William R. Miller in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are working on an agreement.  Court will enter not guilty plea on behalf of def.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant William R. Miller in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reads penalties.  Right to an atty reviewed.  Def wishes to contact DA to see if agreement could be reached.  Def has posted $150.00.  Statement by DA in regards to bond.  Bond set by Court  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
